introduction.text: developed originally for entity extraction (the correct labeling of types of phrases in free text, such as person name, date, organization). Entity extraction performance is typically measured in terms of precision, recall, and balanced f-measure at both the token (word) and phrase level. The top de-identification systems (Szarvas, Farkas, and BusaFekete, 2007; Wellner, et al., 2007) performed well on these measures, as reported at the first i2b2

challenge evaluation (Uzuner, Luo, and Szolovits, 2007), achieving accuracies of over 97% token-level f-measure, with recall (sensitivity) of over 95%. Over the past several years, these results have been extended to more record types and record formats
